answers.answer: Yes, sad, but true, it's possible to have 49% body fat!!Healthy diet and moderate exercise are your best bets for safe weight loss, which is approximately 1-2 pounds/week.You should calculate your daily calorie needs, which are based on height, weight, age and activity level. I can help you do that, if you like.You should also make sure you get some simple blood tests and rule out medical issues, such as hypothyroidism and insulin resistance/type II diabetes as causes for your weight gain.  For hypothyroidism, you need to get tested for TSH, Free T3 and Free T4; for insulin resistance, you need to have tested hemoglobin A1c and fasting blood sugar levels.Good luck and keep posting; we'll help all we can......

question: I am 5'7 220lbs.  I got on my scale yesterday and it says I am 49% fat....is that possible? OMG Its incredible that I have so much fat, almost 50%!! I thought our bodies were about 70% water. :(Now I have decided to take my health seriously and make permanent lifestyle changes.  I have been doing research and I would like to ask your experience on the following:Is there anything I can do to accelerate my fat loss while dieting and exercising?Can a specific type of massage break down fat and toxins?Do you have any words of wisdom that you would like to share that can help me with fat loss?
title: Tanita Scale says I am 48% FAT!
